page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Eastnor is a very picturesque village which lies on the south westerly slopes of the Malvern hills. The scenery is dominated by the castle built in 1812,and the lake in its grounds. On an island in the lake stood the old castle called Castle- ditch,its foundations can still be located where it extended into what is now shallower water between the island and the castle terraces. The park is full of red deer and is a beautiful tourist area attracting groups of campers and caravanners. The village has a charming thatched post office,and the other buildings are old.The focal part of the village is the village primary school and village green.
